title.narrative: CRTA 2022-2026: civil society for democracy and EU, Serbia
CRTA 2022-2026: civilsamhället för demokrati och EU, Serbien

description.narrative: 2.1 The overall objectives of the Core Activities as stated in its Strategic Plan are: CRTA vision: "Serbia with established social and political consensus about the European Union as a partner and EU membership as a defined national interest. Acknowledged firm and unambiguous strategic orientation of the country to develop democracy and political culture, opens society towards European, democracy and human rights values, where citizens are active and persistent in demanding and defending accountable governance." CRTAs strategic commitment for the period 2022-2027 is to contribute in preventing further democratic backsliding and to support creating conditions for developing democratic values and protecting the public interest: 1. CRTA contributes to creating social resiliency against undemocratic and disinformation influences, leading to a more informed and pluralistic society aspiring toward the EU. - Citizens and various stakeholders are provided with access to verified and truthful information on issues of public importance, particularly those related to accountable governance and the rule of law. - CRTA aims to support solidarity and joint actions of civil society initiatives in Serbia in defending the public interest and promoting democratic and European values and to equip and protect them with tools and resources for resisting pressures on their work. - CRTA aims to educate and engage different social groups and professions, including journalists, civic activists, youth, and academia in disclosing and combating undemocratic mechanisms, including disinformation. 2. CRTA contributes to establishing a foundation for institutional accountability, transparency and openness, increasing citizen trust in a democratic perspective. - CRTA is recognized as a credible democracy watchdog by Serbias citizens and democratic actors. - Domestic stakeholders and decision-makers are provided with concrete recommendations and roadmaps for policies that ensure the state's democratic performance and protect the public interest. - Citizens of Serbia recognize the importance of democratic institutions and are encouraged to raise demand for institutional accountability. - International stakeholders interested and engaged in supporting democratic development in Serbia are provided with evidence-based assessments of the state of democracy in Serbia.
Core support to CRTA 2022-2026 and their overal Startegic Plan with narrow focus in the first year on combating disinformation.
Core support to CRTA 2022-2026 and their overal Startegic Plan with narrow focus in the first year on combating disinformation.
